WRITING.TITLE: Remember that early leaked photo of Driver? are there any explanations for it now?
WRITING.TEXT:

What was he doing in an x-wing pilot's uniform? did his role change drastically from x-wing pilot to Knight of Ren? or is this something to do with the story?
I thought that as well. But Finn looks much younger than Kyle, and nowhere near as brave. He might have a similar story.. but not a similar personality

Han Solo + Lyke Skywalker + beard = Kyle Katarn
In my opinion, the coolest character in the whole Star Wars story.
I think for a lot of people, the un-canonization of Kyle Katarn was one of the biggest losses to Star Wars. When many of us begun our own journey's in the Star Wars universe, it was in Kyles boots. It was his lightsaber that we first wielded and his Bryar pistol that we used to shoot down our first stormtroopers. Removing him from the universe was like removing us. Because really, it wasnt Kyle that entered the Valley of the Jedi to fight Jerec or train under Luke Skywalker at the Jedi Academy.. It was us fans that did that.
Will Kyle ever be brought back into canon? I would like to think so, but i know that he wont be. Lets just hope we get a similar character like him in future content. In the mean time... one Ruby bliels please

I've thought about this... and i have a theory.
If JJ has done this right, the situation of forces users would be different to the previous 6 films. Specifically, we wouldnt have a "many-to-few" jedi:Sith ratio as in the PT trilogy, nor will we have a "two-to-two" jedi:sith ratio in the OT trilogy.
What JJ would want to do is potentially have a group of Sith (Knights of Ren etc...) vs a group of Jedi.
Think about it... have we ever seen a group of 5-10 Jedi ever take on a group of 5-10 sith in a Star Wars film? we have not but who would honestly NOT want to see that happen on screen? I personally believe, this is what we have been set up for. the "Knights of Ren" will at some point, take on a group of 5-10 Jedi who have trained under Luke in hiding since ROTJ.
To have only one or two Jedi again would just be boring.

You'll love Dark Forces: Jedi Knight. That game and Jedi outcast defined my gaming life as a child. These two games literally felt like i was actually in a movie.
I hope that we will get another game in future that is as good as these

Thanks for that :)

I think i know why..
People dont want *new* Star Wars content. They just want the *same* content re-released so they can feel the same when as they once did when they where kids. (tbh there is nothing wrong with that but trust me, the same old stuff gets boring. Even i rarely bother to watch ANH or ESB or ROTJ since i saw these movies 200 times when i was younger)
When the cross-guard lightsaber was revealed, everyone went crazy because it wasnt (what they saw in their minds) as the standard Sith red lightsaber. But funnily, this debate happened once before... about 15 years ago.. over a double-sided lightsaber.
People were like "that isnt a real lightsaber" and "how can one fight with that without stabbing one-self" and so on and so forth.
fast foward 14 years later and everyone loves double-bladed lightsabers. They are just as "Star-Warsy" than standard one-blade lightsabers.
Moral of the story... forget the politics, forget the internet, forget the criticism.. just watch the movie with an open mind. Watch the movie through the eyes of a child and not that of an adult and you will be satisfied with whatever daft things get shown.
